name: PDS Ignore Menu Items
author: Pixel Design Studio

sections.description:
This plugin allows you to ignore specific menu items in the frontend, while still keeping them in the backend. This can be useful for pages that you want to exclude from the menu, but still want to keep them accessible in the website’s structure.

To use the plugin, simply activate it and go to Appearance > Menus in the WordPress backend. You will now see a checkbox next to each menu item, which you can use to ignore the item in the frontend.

This plugin is lightweight and easy to use, and can be a great addition to any website.

Features

Adds a checkbox to menu items that allows you to ignore them in the menu, but still keep them in the backend.
Lightweight and easy to use.

Support

If you encounter any issues with this plugin, please let us know. We will do our best to help you out and fix any bugs.

Installation

Download the plugin
Upload the plugin to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

Frequently Asked Questions

Will this plugin affect my website’s performance?

This plugin is lightweight and will not affect your website’s performance.

Can I use this plugin on a live website?

Yes, you can use this plugin on a live website.
